quotes.quote: We are different; we are always have been and always will be. However, different shouldn't divide us, but unify us because different is an asset.
Unity to be real must stand the severest strain without breaking.
Unity without verity is no better than conspiracy.
So powerful is the light of unity that it can illuminate the whole earth.
Unity is strength, division is weakness.
Unity is strength. . . when there is teamwork and collaboration, wonderful things can be achieved.
The significance which is in unity is an eternal wonder.
No doubt, unity is something to be desired, to be striven for, but it cannot be willed by mere declarations.
Behold, how good and how pleasant it is for brothers to dwell together in unity.
United we stand, divided we fall.
Even the weak become strong when they are united.
Where there is unity there is always victory.
There is more power in unity than division.
Where destruction is the motive, unity is dangerous.
In union there is strength.
Not in numbers but in unity that our great strength lies.
Unity is plural and, at minimum, is two.
In Unity there is strength; We can move mountains when we're united and enjoy life --Without unity we are victims. Stay united.
When spiders unite, they can tie down a lion.
You can't have unity without diversity.
Unity is a beast in itself. If a wolf sees two little boys playing in the woods on one side, and a big strong man on the other, he will go to the one who stands alone.
Unity is vision; it must have been part of the process of learning to see.

Unity can only come when there is better co-ordination and mutual understanding in the society; when there is no friction of thoughts and clash of ideologies. We should therefore follow the ideals established by the scholars and engage ourselves in virtuous deeds.
You don't get unity by ignoring the questions that have to be faced.
For the strength of the Pack is the Wolf, and the strength of the Wolf is the Pack.
Unity and victory are synonymous.
All for one, and one for all.
Remember upon the conduct of each depends the fate of all.
We cannot be separated in interest or divided in purpose. We stand together until the end.
